title: Lemon Nut Pound Cake
instructions: Sift together the flour, the baking powder, and the salt and set the ingredients aside.  In a bowl cream together the sugar and the butter.  Add the milk and eggs and continue beating until smooth.  When smooth, add in the flour mixture, the lemon rind, and the lemon juice.  Lastly, fold in the pecans.
Grease the inside bottom of a loaf pan, 9- by 5- by 2-inches, not greasing the sides.  Pour in the batter.

Bake for 50 to 60 minutes, until a toothpick comes out clean from the middle.  Remove the pan from the oven and set it aside to cool for 10 minutes.  After 10 minutes, invert the pan and remove the loaf and let it cool completely before slicing.
source: The Texas Provincial Kitchen by Melissa Guerra, © 1997 by Melissa Guerra.
